heading: music for the masses
subheading: the electronic frontier foundation comes out fighting, with a major new push to protect free expression in the realm of digital music. james glave reports from san francisco.
author: james glave
text: san francisco -- the net's leading free-expression political action group has taken the first steps in its new effort to preserve civil liberties in the digital music arena. the electronic frontier foundation on tuesday hosted the first meeting of the coalition for audio free expression, or cafe, a grassroots group of approximately 50 musicians, technologists, entrepreneurs, and attorneys.cafe is the first major new eff endeavor since the group created and spun off the truste privacy seal program several years ago.read wired news' ongoing mp3 coverage
